jyzer.items
Class ClassObject

java.lang.Object
  jyzer.items.ClassObject

public final class ClassObject
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a simple class entry of the constant pool, it was just created to handle it easily. I could have simply ask the classname from the constantpool, but I thought this way is a little cleaner.

Cares for this_class & super_class entries of the classfile.

Contains the following information:

  • u2 index
    Must be a valid index into the constant_pool table. The entry at that index must be a CONSTANT_Class_info structure.
    If the index is zero then this class must represent the class java.lang.Object in case this is the superclass.
    For an interface, the CONSTANT_Class_info represents the class java.lang.Object

Version:
1.01, 2005 sept 27.
Author:
Legendi Richard Oliver

Method Detail

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Returns the index in the constant_pool.

Returns:
u2 index

getClassName

public java.lang.String getClassName()
Returns the name of the class. Simply asks it from the constant_pool, because this information is needed mostly once with each class, and it wasn't necessary to store this info as a member.

Returns:
the name of the class.

getHTMLDescription

public void getHTMLDescription(java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
Concatenates a HTML string that represents this class ( looks cool! ) to the end of the given StringBiulder object. Using this method for improve efficiency, cause I had a lot of problems with displaying such a long HTML text in an EditorPane.

Parameters:
sb - a StringBuilder that contains the string representation of the full classfile.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
For debugging reasons. I was intrested to overwrite this method.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
the string representation of this object.
